section.title: INTRODUCTION
section.para: LUCID (Unified Computing Image and Data-Processing) is a framework for processing data concurrently via the development of processing units. Each processing unit can have multiple instances that will run in parallel.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: For this framework you can add any number of processing units, make sure your units implementation look like this:
You have examples into the include/headers/pu/ and include/definitions/pu/ directories.
For the program to work use the following list of steps in the main file:

listitem.para: Instantiate the processing units to use.
Use the LoadMemoryManager(void*) function to allocate the size for all the cells in the memory manager.
Create a pointer to a Pipeline and instantiate it with the first processing unit you want to use.
Add all the processing units you want to use for your process.
Iterate throught the data in the MemoryManager object: poping from In and pushing into out to start the process.
Wait for the pipe to finish with the WaitFinish() function.
